alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 9:19PM EST until January 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM SUNDAY TO 7 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches and ice accumulations up to a tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Wyoming, Lackawanna, Luzerne, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. * WHEN...From 3 PM Sunday to 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Slightly warmer temperatures will limit snow and ice amounts in the lower elevations of the Wyoming Valley, where rain likely mixes in. The greatest potential for ice accumulations will be over the higher elevations of the Poconos and surrounding locations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.

area.areaDesc: Lackawanna; Luzerne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Wyoming
